org.jpac

Class SignedInteger

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • org.jpac.Signal
        • org.jpac.SignedInteger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IoSignedInteger

    public class SignedInteger
extends Signal
    represents a signed integer signal

                     java.lang.String identifier,
                     int minValue,
                     int maxValue)
              throws SignalAlreadyExistsException
        constructs a signed integer signal with intrinsic range check
        Parameters:
        containingModule: - module this signal is contained in
        identifier: - identifier of the signal
        minValue: - minimum value signalValid for this signed integer
        maxValue: - maximum value signalValid for this signed integer
        Throws:
        SignalAlreadyExistsException

      • SignedInteger

        public SignedInteger(AbstractModule containingModule,
                     java.lang.String identifier)
              throws SignalAlreadyExistsException
        constructs a signed integer signal with intrinsic range check. range check is disabled.
        Parameters:
        containingModule: - module this signal is contained in
        identifier: - identifier of the signal
        Throws:
        SignalAlreadyExistsException

        Parameters:

        identifier: - identifier of the signal

                     int minValue,

                     SignalAlreadyExistsException

        identifier: - identifier of the signal
        minValue: - minimum value signalValid for this decimal

      • set

        public void set(int value)
         throws NumberOutOfRangeException,
                SignalAccessException
        used to set the signed integer to the given value
        Parameters:
        value: - value, the signed integer is set to
        Throws:
        NumberOutOfRangeException
        SignalAccessException

      • setDeferred

        public void setDeferred(int value)
        used to set the SignedInteger from any thread, which is not a module and not the jPac thread The value is changed synchronized to the jPac cycle
        Parameters:
        value: - value, the signed integer is set to

      • get

        public int get()
        throws SignalInvalidException
        returns the value of the signed integer. If the calling module is the containing module the value of this signal is returned. If the calling module is a foreign module the propagated signal is returned.
        Returns:
        see above
        Throws:
        SignalInvalidException

      • exceeds

        public SignedIntegerExceeds exceeds(int threshold)
        returns a process event (SignedIntegerExceeds), which is fired, if the signed integer exceeds the given threshold
        Parameters:
        threshold: - threshold to be supervised

      • fallsBelow

        public SignedIntegerFallsBelow fallsBelow(int threshold)
        returns a process event (SignedIntegerFallsBelow), which is fired, if the signed integer falls below the given threshold
        Parameters:
        threshold: - threshold to be supervised

      • changes

        public SignedIntegerChanges changes(int baseValue,
                                    int threshold)
        returns a process event (SignedIntegerChanges), which is fired, if the signed integer changes more than the given threshold in relation to the given baseValue
        Parameters:
        baseValue -
        threshold: - threshold to be supervised

      • changes

        public SignedIntegerChanges changes()
        returns a process event (SignedIntegerChanges), which is fired, if the signed integer changes

      • connect

        public void connect(SignedInteger targetSignal)
             throws SignalAlreadyConnectedException
        used to connect this signed integer to another signed integer. One signed integer can be connected to multiple signed integers. The connection is unidirectional: Changes of the connecting signal (sourceSignal) will be propagated to the signals it is connected to (targetSignal): sourceSignal.connect(targetSignal).
        Parameters:
        targetSignal -
        Throws:
        SignalAlreadyConnectedException

      • connect

        public void connect(SignedInteger targetSignal,
                    SignedIntegerMapper signedIntegerMapper)
             throws SignalAlreadyConnectedException,
                    SignalAccessException
        used to connect this signed integer to another signed integer. One signed integer can be connected to multiple signed integers. The connection is unidirectional: Changes of the connecting signal (sourceSignal) will be propagated to the signals it is connected to (targetSignal): sourceSignal.connect(targetSignal).
        Parameters:
        targetSignal -
        signedIntegerMapper -
        Throws:
        SignalAlreadyConnectedException
        SignalAccessException

      • connect

        public void connect(Decimal targetSignal)
             throws SignalAlreadyConnectedException
        used to connect this signed integer to Decimal. One signed integer can be connected to multiple signals. The connection is unidirectional: Changes of the connecting signal (sourceSignal) will be propagated to the signals it is connected to (targetSignal): sourceSignal.connect(targetSignal).
